Generation III.Ruby: Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this Pok é mon brings serenity to living things.
Generation III.Sapphire: On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pok é mon 's head contain a vicious poison.
Generation III.Emerald: A Roselia that drinks nutritionally rich springwater blooms with lovely flowers. The fragrance of its flowers has the effect of making its foes careless.
Generation III.FireRed: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.

Generation IV.Diamond: Roselia raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.
Generation IV.Pearl: The beautiful flowers on its arms have toxic thorns. Don't even think about picking those flowers.
Generation IV.Platinum: The more healthy the Roselia , the more pleasant its flowers' aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
